doc_content:
hwtk::choosedirentry
Entry with browse button that pops up a dialog for the user to select a
        dialog.
Format
hwtk::choosedirentry - pathName ?option value? …

Description
A hwtk::choosedirentry widget displays a one-line text string and allows that string
                to be edited by the user The value of the selected directory may be linked to a Tcl
                variable with the -textvariable option. Entry supports browse
                button which pops up a dialog box for the user to select a directory.

Standard Options


-clientdata
Database name: clientData
Database class: ClientData
Acts as a data storage for a widgets. User can store any data and this
                            will not have any effect on widget property.
-cursor
Database name: cursor
Database class: Cursor
Specifies the mouse cursor to be used for the widget. See
                                Tk_GetCursor and cursors(n) in the Tk
                            reference manual for the legal values. If set to the empty string (the
                            default), the cursor is inherited from the parent widget.
-help
Database name: help
Database class: Text
Specifies the text or help message that displays when the cursor moves
                            over the widget.
-helpcommand
Database name: helpcommand
Database class: Command
Dynamic help which calls an assigned -helpcommand
                            when the user moves the mouse on the widget. The text which is returned
                            by the -helpcommand will be in turn be displayed on
                            the tooltip.
-marker
Database name: marker
Database class: Marker
Specifies the color of the marker decorator. Can be either
                                info, error, or
                                warning. If not specified, hide the marker.
-state
Database name: state
Database class: State
May be set to normal or disabled to control the disabled state bit.
-takefocus
Database name: takeFocus
Database class: TakeFocus
Determines whether the window accepts the focus during keyboard
                            traversal. Either 0, 1, a command prefix (to which the widget path is
                            appended, and which should return 0 or 1), or the empty string. See
                                options(n) in the Tk reference manual for the full
                            description.
-textvariable
Database name: textVariable
Database class: Variable
Specifies the name of a global variable. The value of the variable is a
                            text string to be displayed inside the widget; if the variable value
                            changes then the widget will automatically update itself to reflect the
                            new value. The way in which the string is displayed in the widget
                            depends on the particular widget and may be determined by other options,
                            such as anchor or justify.
-width
Database name: width
Database class: Width
Specifies the width of a widget.



Widget-Specific Options


-buttonpos
Database name: buttonpos
Database class: Buttonpos
The position of the file browse button in relation to the file entry.
                            Valid values are e, w,
                                left and right.
-command
Database name: command
Database class: Command
A script to evaluate when the widget is invoked.
-initialdir
Database name: initialdir
Database class: Initialdir
Specifies that the directories in directory should be
                            displayed when the dialog pops up. If this parameter is not specified,
                            then the directories in the current working directory are displayed. If
                            the parameter specifies a relative path, the return value will convert
                            the relative path to an absolute path.
-invalidcommand
Database name: invalidCommand
Database class: InvalidCommand
A script template to evaluate whenever the validate
                            command returns 0. See Validation for more information.
-justify
Database name: justify
Database class: Justify
Specifies how the text is aligned within the entry widget. One of
                                left, center, or
                                right.
-mustexist
Database name: mustexist
Database class: Mustexist
Specifies whether the user may specify non-existent directories. If this
                            parameter is true, then the user may only select directories that
                            already exist. The default value is false.
-parent
Database name: parent
Database class: Parent
Makes window the logical parent of the dialog. The dialog is displayed
                            on top of its parent window. 
-title
Database name: title
Database class: Title
Specifies a string to display as the title of the dialog box. If this
                            option is not specified, then a default title will be displayed.
-validate
Database name: validate
Database class: Validate
Specifies the mode in which validation should operate:
                                none, focus,
                                focusin, focusout,
                                key, or all. Default is
                                none, meaning that validation is disabled. See
                                Validation.
-validatecommand
Database name: validateCommand
Database class: ValidateCommand
A script template to evaluate whenever validation is triggered. If set
                            to the empty string (the default), validation is disabled. The script
                            must return a boolean value. See Validation.



Widget Command
In addition to the standard
                        configure, cget,
                        identify, instate, and
                        state commands, this command support the following
                    additional widget commands:
pathName
configure
?option? ?value option value …?
Query or modify the configuration options of the widget. If one or more
                            option-value pairs are specified, then the command modifies the given
                            widget option(s) to have the given value(s); in this case the command
                            returns an empty string. If option is specified with no
                            value, then the command returns a list describing the named
                                option: the elements of the list are the option
                            name, database name, database class, default value, and current value.
                            If no option is specified, returns a list describing all of the
                            available options for pathName.
pathName
cget
option
Returns the current value of the configuration option given by
                            option.
pathName
identify
element x y
Returns the name of the element under the point given by x and y, or an
                            empty string if the point does not lie within any element. x and y are
                            pixel coordinates relative to the widget. Some widgets accept other
                            identify subcommands.
pathName
instate
statespec ?script?
Test the widget’s state. If script is not specified, returns 1 if the
                            widget state matches statespec and 0 otherwise. If script is specified,
                            equivalent to
                            if{[pathNameinstatestateSpec]}script
pathName
state
?stateSpec?
Modify or inquire widget state. If stateSpec is
                            present, sets the widget state: for each flag in
                                stateSpec, sets the corresponding flag or clears it
                            if prefixed by an exclamation point. Returns a new state spec indicating
                            which flags were changed:
                            setchanges[pathNamestatespec]
pathNamestate$changeswill
                            restore pathName to the original state. If
                                stateSpec is not specified, returns a list of the
                            currently-enabled state flags.
pathName
bbox
index
Returns a list of four numbers describing the bounding box of the
                            character given by index. The first two elements of the
                            list give the x and y coordinates of the upper-left corner of the screen
                            area covered by the character (in pixels relative to the widget) and the
                            last two elements give the width and height of the character, in pixels.
                            The bounding box may refer to a region outside the visible area of the
                            window.
pathName
delete
first ?last?
Delete one or more elements of the entry. First is the
                            index of the first character to delete, and last is the
                            index of the character just after the last one to delete. If
                                last isn’t specified it defaults to
                                first+1, that is, a single character is deleted.
                            This command returns the empty string.
pathName
get
Returns the entry’s string.
pathName
icursor
index
Arrange for the insert cursor to be displayed just before the character
                            given by index. Returns the empty string.
pathName
index
string
Arrange for the insert cursor to be displayed just before the character
                            given by index. Returns the empty string.
pathName
insert
 index string
Insert string just before the character indicated by
                                index. Returns the empty string.
pathName
selection
option arg
This command is used to adjust the selection within an entry. It has
                            several forms, depending on option:
pathName
selection
clear
Clear the selection if it is currently in this widget. If
                                        the selection isn’t in this widget then the command has no
                                        effect. Returns the empty string.
pathName
selection
present
Returns 1 if there is are characters selected in the entry,
                                        0 if nothing is selected.
pathName
selection range
start end
Sets the selection to include the characters starting with
                                        the one indexed by start and ending with
                                        the one just before end. If
                                            end refers to the same character as
                                            start or an earlier one, then the
                                        entry’s selection is cleared.


pathName
set
str
Sets the entry’s value to str.
pathName
xview
args
This command is used to query and change the horizontal position of the
                            text in the widget’s window. It can take any of the following forms:
pathName
xview
Returns a list containing two elements. Each element is a
                                        real fraction between 0 and 1; together they describe the
                                        horizontal span that is visible in the window. For example,
                                        if the first element is .2 and the second element is .6, 20%
                                        of the entry’s text is offscreen to the left, the middle 40%
                                        is visible in the window, and 40% of the text is offscreen
                                        to the right. These are the same values passed to scrollbars
                                        via the -xscrollcommand option.


pathName
xview
index
Adjusts the view in the window so that the character given
                                        by index is displayed at the left edge of
                                        the window.
pathName
xview moveto
fraction
Adjusts the view in the window so that the character
                                            fraction of the way through the text
                                        appears at the left edge of the window.
                                            fraction must be a fraction between 0
                                        and 1.
pathName
xview scroll
number what
This command shifts the view in the window left or right
                                        according to number and
                                            what. Number must be
                                        an integer. What must be either units or
                                        pages. If what is units, the view adjusts
                                        left or right by number average width
                                        characters on the display; if it is pages then the view
                                        adjusts by number screenfuls. If
                                            number is negative then characters
                                        farther to the left become visible; if it is positive then
                                        characters farther to the right become visible.





Example

::hwtk::dialog .d -title "::hwtk::choosedirentry"
set f [.d recess]

hwtk::label $f.11 -text "Enabled"
hwtk::choosedirentry $f.e1 

hwtk::label $f.12 -text "Disabled"
hwtk::choosedirentry $f.e2 -state "disabled"

grid columconfigure $f 1 -weight 1
for {set i 1} {$i<=2} {incr i} {
    grid $f.l$i -row $i -col 0 -sticky w;
    grid $f.e$i -row $i -col 1 -sticky e -pady 2
}

.d post
translated_doc_content:
hwtk:：选择目录条目
带有浏览按钮的条目，弹出对话框供用户选择
对话
总体安排
hwtk:：choosedirentry-pathName？选项值…

描述
hwtk:：choosedirentry小部件显示一行文本字符串，并允许该字符串
由用户编辑所选目录的值可以链接到Tcl
带有-textvariable选项的变量。条目支持浏览
按钮，弹出一个对话框供用户选择目录。

标准选项


-客户端数据
数据库名称：clientData
数据库类：ClientData
充当小部件的数据存储。用户可以存储任何数据，并且
不会对小部件属性产生任何影响。
-光标
数据库名称：游标
数据库类：游标
指定要用于小部件的鼠标光标。看见
Tk_GetCursor和Tk中的游标（n）
法律价值参考手册。如果设置为空字符串（
默认值），则光标从父窗口小部件继承。
帮助
数据库名称：帮助
数据库类：文本
指定光标移动时显示的文本或帮助消息
通过小部件。
-help命令
数据库名称：helpcommand
数据库类：命令
调用已分配-help命令的动态帮助
当用户在小部件上移动鼠标时。返回的文本
通过-help命令将依次显示在
工具提示。
-标记
数据库名称：标记
数据库类：Marker
指定标记装饰器的颜色。可以是任意一种
信息、错误或
警告如果未指定，请隐藏标记。
状态
数据库名称：状态
数据库类：State
可以设置为正常或禁用以控制禁用状态位。
-聚焦
数据库名称：takeFocus
数据库类：TakeFocus
确定窗口在键盘操作期间是否接受焦点
遍历。0、1或命令前缀（小部件路径指向的前缀
已附加，应返回0或1），或空字符串。请参阅
完整的Tk参考手册中的选项（n）
描述
-text变量
数据库名称：textVariable
数据库类：变量
指定全局变量的名称。变量的值是
要在小部件内部显示的文本字符串；如果变量值
更改后，小部件将自动更新自身以反映
新的价值。字符串在小部件中显示的方式
取决于特定的小部件，并且可以由其他选项来确定，
例如锚定或定位。
宽度
数据库名称：宽度
数据库类：宽度
指定小部件的宽度。



小工具特定选项


-按钮位置
数据库名称：buttonpos
数据库类：Buttonpos
文件浏览按钮相对于文件条目的位置。
有效值为e、w、，
左和右。
命令
数据库名称：命令
数据库类：命令
调用小部件时要评估的脚本。
-initialdir
数据库名称：initialdir
数据库类：Initialdir
指定目录中的目录应为
对话框弹出时显示。如果没有指定该参数，
则显示当前工作目录中的目录。如果
该参数指定一个相对路径，返回值将转换
相对路径到绝对路径。
-invalidcommand
数据库名称：invalidCommand
数据库类：InvalidCommand
验证时要评估的脚本模板
命令返回0。有关详细信息，请参阅验证。
证明正当
数据库名称：对齐
数据库类：Justify
指定文本在条目小部件中的对齐方式。什么之中的一个
左侧、中间或
正确的
-必须存在
数据库名称：必须存在
数据库类：Mustexist
指定用户是否可以指定不存在的目录。如果这样
参数为true，则用户只能选择
已经存在。默认值为false。
父母亲
数据库名称：父级
数据库类：父类
使窗口成为对话框的逻辑父窗口。显示对话框
在其父窗口的顶部。
标题
数据库名称：title
数据库类：标题
指定要显示为对话框标题的字符串。如果这样
选项，则将显示默认标题。
验证
数据库名称：validate
数据库类：验证
指定验证操作的模式：
无，聚焦，
聚焦，聚焦，
键或全部。默认为
none，意味着验证被禁用。看见
验证。
-验证命令
数据库名称：validateCommand
数据库类：ValidateCommand
每当触发验证时要评估的脚本模板。如果设置
对于空字符串（默认值），将禁用验证。脚本
必须返回布尔值。请参阅验证。



小工具命令
除了标准
configure、cget，
识别、安装和

其他小部件命令：

页。如果什么是单位，则视图会调整
左或右按数字平均宽度
显示器上的字符；如果是页面，则视图
按筛选次数进行调整。如果
数字为负数，然后为个字符
向左更远的地方变得可见；如果是正的，那么
更右边的字符变得可见。





实例

：：hwtk:：dialog.d-title“：：hwtk:：choosedirentry”
集合f[.d凹陷]

hwtk:：label$f.11-text“已启用”
hwtk:：选择目录条目$f.e1

hwtk:：label$f.12-text“已禁用”
hwtk:：choosedirentry$f.e2-状态“已禁用”

网格列配置$f 1-权重1
对于｛set i 1｝｛$i＜＝2｝｛｛incr i｝{
网格$f.l$i-行$i-列0-粘性w；
网格$f.e$i-行$i-列1-粘性电子板2
}

.d帖子

doc_content:
hwtk::colorbutton
Button with popdown color pallet.
Format
hwtk::colorbutton - pathName ?option value? …

Description
A hwtk::colorbutton widget is a button which includes a popdown color pallet. The
                button itself contains no text, but shows the selected color. When clicked, the
                color pallet appears below the button, which shows the currently selected color
                (highlighted) and allows a new color to be chosen.

Standard Options


-clientdata
Database name: clientData
Database class: ClientData
Acts as a data storage for a widgets. User can store any data and this
                            will not have any effect on widget property.
-help
Database name: help
Database class: Text
Specifies the text or help message that displays when the cursor moves
                            over the widget.
-helpcommand
Database name: helpcommand
Database class: Command
Dynamic help which calls an assigned -helpcommand
                            when the user moves the mouse on the widget. The text which is returned
                            by the -helpcommand will be in turn be displayed on
                            the tooltip.
-state
Database name: state
Database class: State
May be set to normal or disabled to control the disabled state bit.
-takefocus
Database name: takeFocus
Database class: TakeFocus
Determines whether the window accepts the focus during keyboard
                            traversal. Either 0, 1, a command prefix (to which the widget path is
                            appended, and which should return 0 or 1), or the empty string. See
                                options(n) in the Tk reference manual for the full
                            description.



Widget-Specific Options


-color
Database name: color
Database class: Color
The selected color in the color pallet, which is displayed by the color
                            button itself. Can be given as an integer, hexadecimal, or RGB
                            value.
-command
Database name: command
Database class: Command
A script to evaluate when the widget is invoked.
-padding
Database name: padding
Database class: Pad
Specifies the amount of extra space to allocate for the widget. The
                            padding is a list of up to four length specifications left, top, right,
                            bottom. If fewer than four elements are specified, bottom defaults to
                            top, right defaults to left, and top defaults to left.
-startindex
Database name: startindex
Database class: Index
Specifies the start index for the color values. In HyperMesh, the color values are 0-based (from
                            0-63), whereas in HyperMesh Desktop, the
                            color values are 1-based (1-64). Acceptable values are 0 and 1; default
                            value is 0.
-values
Database name: values
Database class: Values
Specifies the colors to be displayed in the dropdown color pallet. By
                            default, all 64 colors are shown, but if the user wants only a subset of
                            colors to be shown, a list of color values can be specified using this
                            option. Acceptable values which can be included in the list are integers
                            from 0-63 or 1-64, depending on the value specified by
                                -startindex.



Widget Command


pathName
configure
?option? ?value option value …?
Query or modify the configuration options of the widget. If one or more
                            option-value pairs are specified, then the command modifies the given
                            widget option(s) to have the given value(s); in this case the command
                            returns an empty string. If option is specified with no
                            value, then the command returns a list describing the named
                                option: the elements of the list are the option
                            name, database name, database class, default value, and current value.
                            If no option is specified, returns a list describing all of the
                            available options for pathName.
pathName
cget
option
Returns the current value of the configuration option given by
                            option.
pathName
identify
element x y
Returns the name of the element under the point given by x and y, or an
                            empty string if the point does not lie within any element. x and y are
                            pixel coordinates relative to the widget. Some widgets accept other
                            identify subcommands.
pathName
instate
statespec ?script?
Test the widget’s state. If script is not specified, returns 1 if the
                            widget state matches statespec and 0 otherwise. If script is specified,
                            equivalent to
                            if{[pathNameinstatestateSpec]}script
pathName
state
?stateSpec?
Modify or inquire widget state. If stateSpec is
                            present, sets the widget state: for each flag in
                                stateSpec, sets the corresponding flag or clears it
                            if prefixed by an exclamation point. Returns a new state spec indicating
                            which flags were changed:
                            setchanges[pathNamestatespec]
pathNamestate$changeswill
                            restore pathName to the original state. If
                                stateSpec is not specified, returns a list of the
                            currently-enabled state flags.
pathName
color
?index
Sets the value of the colorbutton to the color given by
                                index. Acceptable values are 1-64. If no index is
                            given, this command returns the current value of the colorbutton.
pathName
get
?arg arg...?
Gets the value of the color button, or the settings specified in the
                            arguments.
pathName
invoke
Invokes color button. 
pathName
set
color
Sets the value of the color button.



Example

::hwtk::dialog .dlg -title "::hwtk::colorbutton" -height 8
set w [.dlg recess]

pack [hwtk::labelframe $w.f2 -text "colorbutton"] -anchor nw -pady 10 -padx 10 

namespace eval ::test {
    proc SetColor {F i color rgb} {
        $F configure -background $color
        set ::test::Prive(integer) $1
        set ::test::Prive(hexa) $color
        set ::test::Prive(rgb) $rgb
}
frame $w.f2.f1 -width 50 -relief groove -borderwidth 2
grid[hwtk::label $w.f2.10 -text "Color Button"][hwtk::colorbutton $w.f2.b -color 16 -command "::test::SetColor $w.f2.f1 %I %H {%R}"] -pady 4 -padx 4 -sticky w   
grid[hwtk::label$w.f2.11 -text "Color Integer"][hwtk::entry $w.f2.e1 -textvariable ::test::Prive(integer) -state readonly]  $w.f2.f1 -pady 4 -padx 4 -sticky w 
grid[hwtk::label$w.f2.12 -text "Color Hexa"][hwtk::entry $w.f2.e2 -textvariable ::test::Prive(hexa) -state readonly] -pady 4 -padx 4 -sticky w 
grid[hwtk::label$w.f2.13 -text "Color RGB"][hwtk::entry $w.f2.e3 -textvariable ::test::Prive(rgb) -state readonly] -pady 4 -padx 4 -sticky w 
grid configure $w.f2.f1 -rowspan 3 -stickynews

# This will set the color for the button and invokes the user command

$w.f2.b configure -color 26;

.dlg post
translated_doc_content:
hwtk:：color按钮
带有弹出式调色板的按钮。
总体安排
hwtk:：colorbutton-pathName？选项值…

描述
hwtk:：colorbutton小部件是一个包含弹出式调色板的按钮。这个
按钮本身不包含任何文本，但显示所选的颜色。单击时
调色板显示在按钮下方，显示当前选定的颜色
（高亮显示），并允许选择新的颜色。

标准选项


-客户端数据
数据库名称：clientData
数据库类：ClientData
充当小部件的数据存储。用户可以存储任何数据，并且
不会对小部件属性产生任何影响。
帮助
数据库名称：帮助
数据库类：文本
指定光标移动时显示的文本或帮助消息
通过小部件。
-help命令
数据库名称：helpcommand
数据库类：命令
调用已分配-help命令的动态帮助
当用户在小部件上移动鼠标时。返回的文本
通过-help命令将依次显示在
工具提示。
状态
数据库名称：状态
数据库类：State
可以设置为正常或禁用以控制禁用状态位。
-聚焦
数据库名称：takeFocus
数据库类：TakeFocus
确定窗口在键盘操作期间是否接受焦点
遍历。0、1或命令前缀（小部件路径指向的前缀
已附加，应返回0或1），或空字符串。请参阅
完整的Tk参考手册中的选项（n）
描述



小工具特定选项


颜色
数据库名称：颜色
数据库类：颜色
调色板中所选的颜色，由颜色显示
按钮本身。可以给定为整数、十六进制或RGB
价值
命令
数据库名称：命令
数据库类：命令
调用小部件时要评估的脚本。
衬料
数据库名称：填充
数据库类：Pad
指定要为小部件分配的额外空间量。这个
padding是最多四个长度规格的列表，左、上、右、，
底部如果指定的元素少于四个，则底部默认为
top，right默认为left，top默认为left。
-startindex
数据库名称：startindex
数据库类：索引
指定颜色值的起始索引。在HyperMesh中，颜色值基于0（从
0-63），而在HyperMesh Desktop中
颜色值是基于1的（1-64）。可接受的值为0和1；违约
值为0。
价值观
数据库名称：值
数据库类：值
指定要在下拉调色板中显示的颜色。通过
默认情况下，显示所有64种颜色，但如果用户只想要的子集
要显示的颜色，可以使用此指定颜色值的列表
选项可包含在列表中的可接受值为整数
0-63或1-64，具体取决于
-startindex。



小工具命令


路径名称
配置
?选项value选项值…？
查询或修改小部件的配置选项。如果一个或多个
指定选项值对，然后该命令修改给定的
具有给定值的窗口小部件选项；在这种情况下，命令
返回一个空字符串。如果指定选项时没有
值，则该命令返回一个列表，描述命名的
选项：列表中的元素是选项
名称、数据库名称、数据库类、默认值和当前值。
如果未指定任何选项，则返回一个列表，其中描述
pathName的可用选项。
路径名称
cget
选项
返回由给定的配置选项的当前值
选项
路径名称
识别
元素x y
返回由x和y给定的点下的元素的名称，或
如果点不在任何元素内，则为空字符串。x和y是
相对于小部件的像素坐标。一些小部件接受其他
识别子命令。
路径名称
任命
州规范？剧本
测试小部件的状态。如果未指定脚本，则如果
小部件状态与statespec匹配，否则为0。如果指定了脚本，
相当于
if｛[pathNameinstatesteSpec]｝脚本
路径名称
状态
?stateSpec？
修改或查询小部件状态。如果stateSpec为
present，设置小部件状态：对于中的每个标志
stateSpec，设置相应的标志或将其清除
如果前缀是感叹号。返回一个新的状态规范，指示
哪些标志已更改：
setchanges[pathNamestatespec]
路径名称状态$changeswill
将pathName恢复到原始状态。如果
未指定stateSpec，返回的列表
当前启用的状态标志。
路径名称
颜色
?指数
将colorbutton的值设置为给定的颜色
指数可接受的值为1-64。如果没有索引
给定时，此命令返回colorbutton的当前值。
路径名称
收到
?arg arg。。。？
获取颜色按钮的值，或在
论据。
路径名称
援引
调用颜色按钮。
路径名称
设置
颜色
设置颜色按钮的值。



实例

：hwtk:：dialog.dlg-title“：：hwtk：：colorbutton”-高度8
设置w[.dlg凹陷]

pack[hwtk:：labelframe$w.f2-text“colorbutton”]-anchor nw-pady 10-padx 10

命名空间eval:：test{
proc SetColor｛F i color rgb｝{
$F配置-背景$color
set:：test:：Prive（整数）$1
集合：：测试：Prive（hexa）$color
集合：：测试：：Prive（rgb）$rgb
}
框架$w.f2.f1-宽度50-浮雕槽-边框宽度2
grid[hwtk:：label$w.f2.10-text“Color Button”][hwtk：：colorbutton$w.f2.b-Color 16-command“：：test:：SetColor$w.f2.f1%I%H｛%R｝”]-pady 4-padx 4-stick w
grid[hwtk:：label$w.f2.11-text“Color Integer”][hwtk：：entry$w.f2.e1-textvariable:：test:：Prive（Integer）-state readonly]$w.f2.f1-pady 4-padx 4-stick w
grid[hwtk:：label$w.f2.12-text“Color Hexa”][hwtk：：entry$w.f2.e2-textvariable:：test:：Prive（Hexa）-state readonly]-pady 4-padx 4-stick w
grid[hwtk:：label$w.f2.13-text“Color RGB”][hwtk：：entry$w.f2.e3-textvariable:：test:：Prive（RGB）-state readonly]-pady 4-padx 4-stick w
网格配置$w.f2.f1-行3-stickynews

#这将设置按钮的颜色并调用用户命令

$w.f2.b配置-颜色26；

.dlg帖子

doc_content:
hwtk::combobox
Text field with popdown selection list.
Format
hwtk::combobox - pathName ?option value? …

Description
A hwtk::combobox combines a text field with a pop-down list of values; the user may
                select the value of the text field from among the values in the list.

Standard Options


-clientdata
Database name: clientData
Database class: ClientData
Acts as a data storage for a widgets. User can store any data and this
                            will not have any effect on widget property.
-cursor
Database name: cursor
Database class: Cursor
Specifies the mouse cursor to be used for the widget. See
                                Tk_GetCursor and cursors(n) in the Tk
                            reference manual for the legal values. If set to the empty string (the
                            default), the cursor is inherited from the parent widget.
-height
Database name: height
Database class: Height
If specified, the widget’s requested height in pixels.
-help
Database name: help
Database class: Text
Specifies the text or help message that displays when the cursor moves
                            over the widget.
-helpcommand
Database name: helpcommand
Database class: Command
Dynamic help which calls an assigned -helpcommand
                            when the user moves the mouse on the widget. The text which is returned
                            by the -helpcommand will be in turn be displayed on
                            the tooltip.
-marker
Database name: marker
Database class: Marker
Specifies the color of the marker decorator. Can be either
                                info, error, or
                                warning. If not specified, hide the marker.
-state
Database name: state
Database class: State
May be set to normal or disabled to control the disabled state bit.
-takefocus
Database name: takeFocus
Database class: TakeFocus
Determines whether the window accepts the focus during keyboard
                            traversal. Either 0, 1, a command prefix (to which the widget path is
                            appended, and which should return 0 or 1), or the empty string. See
                                options(n) in the Tk reference manual for the full
                            description.
-textvariable
Database name: textVariable
Database class: Variable
Specifies the name of a global variable. The value of the variable is a
                            text string to be displayed inside the widget; if the variable value
                            changes then the widget will automatically update itself to reflect the
                            new value. The way in which the string is displayed in the widget
                            depends on the particular widget and may be determined by other options,
                            such as anchor or justify.
-width
Database name: width
Database class: Width
Specifies the width of a widget.
-xscrollcommand
Database name: xScrollCommand
Database class: ScrollCommand
Specifies the prefix for a command used to communicate with horizontal
                            scrollbars. When the view in the widget’s window changes (or whenever
                            anything else occurs that could change the display in a scrollbar, such
                            as a change in the total size of the widget’s contents), the widget will
                            generate a Tcl command by concatenating the scroll command and two
                            numbers. Each of the numbers is a fraction between 0 and 1, which
                            indicates a position in the document. 0 indicates the beginning of the
                            document, 1 indicates the end, .333 indicates a position one third the
                            way through the document, and so on. The first fraction indicates the
                            first information in the document that is visible in the window, and the
                            second fraction indicates the information just after the last portion
                            that is visible. The command is then passed to the Tcl interpreter for
                            execution. Typically the xScrollCommand option consists
                            of the path name of a scrollbar widget followed by



Widget-Specific Options


-invalidcommand
Database name: invalidCommand
Database class: InvalidCommand
A script template to evaluate whenever the validate
                            command returns 0. See Validation for more information.
-justify
Database name: justify
Database class: Justify
Specifies how the text is aligned within the entry widget. One of
                                left, center, or
                                right.
-postcommand
Database name: postCommand
Database class: PostCommand
A Tcl script to evaluate immediately before displaying the listbox. The
                                -postcommand script may specify the
                                -values to display.
-scrollable
Database name: scrollable
Database class: Scrollable
Boolean option that when set to true allows the current value to be
                            changed with mouse scrolling.
-selcommand
Database name: selcommand
Database class: Command
A Tcl script to evaluate immediately after selecting from the dropdown
                            listbox.
-validate
Database name: validate
Database class: Validate
Specifies the mode in which validation should operate:
                                none, focus,
                                focusin, focusout,
                                key, or all. Default is
                                none, meaning that validation is disabled. See
                                Validation.
-validatecommand
Database name: validateCommand
Database class: ValidateCommand
A script template to evaluate whenever validation is triggered. If set
                            to the empty string (the default), validation is disabled. The script
                            must return a boolean value. See Validation.
-values
Database name: values
Database class: Values
Specifies the list of values to display in the drop-down listbox.



Widget Command
In addition to the standard
                        configure, cget,
                        identify, instate, and
                        state commands, this command support the following
                    additional widget commands:
pathName
bbox
index
Returns a list of four numbers describing the bounding box of the
                            character given by index. The first two elements of the
                            list give the x and y coordinates of the upper-left corner of the screen
                            area covered by the character (in pixels relative to the widget) and the
                            last two elements give the width and height of the character, in pixels.
                            The bounding box may refer to a region outside the visible area of the
                            window.
pathName
delete
first ?last?
Delete one or more elements of the entry. First is the
                            index of the first character to delete, and last is the
                            index of the character just after the last one to delete. If
                                last isn’t specified it defaults to
                                first+1, that is, a single character is deleted.
                            This command returns the empty string.
pathName
invoke
Invokes color button. 
pathName
get
Returns the current value of the combobox.
pathName
icursor
index
Arrange for the insert cursor to be displayed just before the character
                            given by index. Returns the empty string.
pathName
index
string
Returns the index of the given string in the combo box.
pathName
insert
 index string
Insert string just before the character indicated by
                                index. Returns the empty string.
pathName
invoke
index
Invokes the action of the combobox selection.
pathName
selection
option arg
This command is used to adjust the selection within an entry. It has
                            several forms, depending on option:
pathName
selection
clear
Clear the selection if it is currently in this widget. If
                                        the selection isn’t in this widget then the command has no
                                        effect. Returns the empty string.
pathName
selection
present
Returns 1 if there is are characters selected in the entry,
                                        0 if nothing is selected.
pathName
selection range
start end
Sets the selection to include the characters starting with
                                        the one indexed by start and ending with
                                        the one just before end. If
                                            end refers to the same character as
                                            start or an earlier one, then the
                                        entry’s selection is cleared.


pathName
set
value
Sets the value of the combobox to value.
pathName
xview
args
This command is used to query and change the horizontal position of the
                            text in the widget’s window. It can take any of the following forms:
pathName
xview
Returns a list containing two elements. Each element is a
                                        real fraction between 0 and 1; together they describe the
                                        horizontal span that is visible in the window. For example,
                                        if the first element is .2 and the second element is .6, 20%
                                        of the entry’s text is offscreen to the left, the middle 40%
                                        is visible in the window, and 40% of the text is offscreen
                                        to the right. These are the same values passed to scrollbars
                                        via the -xscrollcommand option.


pathName
xview
index
Adjusts the view in the window so that the character given
                                        by index is displayed at the left edge of
                                        the window.
pathName
xview moveto
fraction
Adjusts the view in the window so that the character
                                            fraction of the way through the text
                                        appears at the left edge of the window.
                                            fraction must be a fraction between 0
                                        and 1.
pathName
xview scroll
number what
This command shifts the view in the window left or right
                                        according to number and
                                            what. Number must be
                                        an integer. What must be either units or
                                        pages. If what is units, the view adjusts
                                        left or right by number average width
                                        characters on the display; if it is pages then the view
                                        adjusts by number screenfuls. If
                                            number is negative then characters
                                        farther to the left become visible; if it is positive then
                                        characters farther to the right become visible.





Example

::hwtk::dialog .d -title "::hwtk::combobox"
set f [.d recess]

set cities [list Athens Berlin Brussels London Paris Vienna Zurich]

hwtk::label $f.11 -text "Default"  
hwtk::combobox $f.cb1 -values $cities -help "Capital Cities"

hwtk::label $f.12 -text "Disable"
hwtk::combobox $f.cb2 -values $cities -help "Capital Cities" -state disabled 

grid columnconfigure $f 1 -weight 1
for {set i 1} {$i<=2} {incr i} {
    grid $f.1$i -row $i -col 0 -sticky w;
    grid $f.cb$i -row $i -col 1 -sticky e -pady 2
}
.d post
translated_doc_content:
hwtk:：组合框
带有弹出选择列表的文本字段。
总体安排
hwtk:：combobox-pathName？选项值…

描述
hwtk:：组合框将一个文本字段与一个弹出的值列表组合在一起；用户可以
从列表中的值中选择文本字段的值。

标准选项


-客户端数据
数据库名称：clientData
数据库类：ClientData
充当小部件的数据存储。用户可以存储任何数据，并且
不会对小部件属性产生任何影响。
-光标
数据库名称：游标
数据库类：游标
指定要用于小部件的鼠标光标。看见
Tk_GetCursor和Tk中的游标（n）
法律价值参考手册。如果设置为空字符串（
默认值），则光标从父窗口小部件继承。
身高
数据库名称：高度
数据库类：高度
如果指定，小部件请求的高度（以像素为单位）。
帮助
数据库名称：帮助
数据库类：文本
指定光标移动时显示的文本或帮助消息
通过小部件。
-help命令
数据库名称：helpcommand
数据库类：命令
调用已分配-help命令的动态帮助
当用户在小部件上移动鼠标时。返回的文本
通过-help命令将依次显示在
工具提示。
-标记
数据库名称：标记
数据库类：Marker
指定标记装饰器的颜色。可以是任意一种
信息、错误或

数据库类：ScrollCommand

作为小部件内容总大小的变化），小部件将
通过将滚动命令和两个
数字。每个数字都是0到1之间的一个分数
指示文档中的位置。0表示的开始
文档，1表示结束，.333表示三分之一的位置
通过文档的方式，依此类推。第一个分数表示
文档中在窗口中可见的第一个信息，以及
第二部分表示最后一部分之后的信息
这是可见的。然后将该命令传递给Tcl解释器，用于
处决xScrollCommand选项通常包括
的路径名，后跟

左侧、中间或
正确的

doc_content:
hwtk::entry
Editable text field widget.
Format
hwtk::entry - pathName ?option value? …

Description
An entry widget displays a one-line text string and allows that string to be edited
                by the user. The value of the string may be linked to a Tcl variable with the
                    -textvariable option. Entry widgets support horizontal
                scrolling with the standard -xscrollcommand option and
                    xview widget command.

Standard Options


-clientdata
Database name: clientData
Database class: ClientData
Acts as a data storage for a widgets. User can store any data and this
                            will not have any effect on widget property.
-cursor
Database name: cursor
Database class: Cursor
Specifies the mouse cursor to be used for the widget. See
                                Tk_GetCursor and cursors(n) in the Tk
                            reference manual for the legal values. If set to the empty string (the
                            default), the cursor is inherited from the parent widget.
-help
Database name: help
Database class: Text
Specifies the text or help message that displays when the cursor moves
                            over the widget.
-helpcommand
Database name: helpcommand
Database class: Command
Dynamic help which calls an assigned -helpcommand
                            when the user moves the mouse on the widget. The text which is returned
                            by the -helpcommand will be in turn be displayed on
                            the tooltip.
-marker
Database name: marker
Database class: Marker
Specifies the color of the marker decorator. Can be either
                                info, error, or
                                warning. If not specified, hide the marker.
-state
Database name: state
Database class: State
May be set to normal or disabled to control the disabled state bit.
-takefocus
Database name: takeFocus
Database class: TakeFocus
Determines whether the window accepts the focus during keyboard
                            traversal. Either 0, 1, a command prefix (to which the widget path is
                            appended, and which should return 0 or 1), or the empty string. See
                                options(n) in the Tk reference manual for the full
                            description.
-textvariable
Database name: textVariable
Database class: Variable
Specifies the name of a global variable. The value of the variable is a
                            text string to be displayed inside the widget; if the variable value
                            changes then the widget will automatically update itself to reflect the
                            new value. The way in which the string is displayed in the widget
                            depends on the particular widget and may be determined by other options,
                            such as anchor or justify.
-width
Database name: width
Database class: Width
Specifies the width of a widget.
-xscrollcommand
Database name: xScrollCommand
Database class: ScrollCommand
Specifies the prefix for a command used to communicate with horizontal
                            scrollbars. When the view in the widget’s window changes (or whenever
                            anything else occurs that could change the display in a scrollbar, such
                            as a change in the total size of the widget’s contents), the widget will
                            generate a Tcl command by concatenating the scroll command and two
                            numbers. Each of the numbers is a fraction between 0 and 1, which
                            indicates a position in the document. 0 indicates the beginning of the
                            document, 1 indicates the end, .333 indicates a position one third the
                            way through the document, and so on. The first fraction indicates the
                            first information in the document that is visible in the window, and the
                            second fraction indicates the information just after the last portion
                            that is visible. The command is then passed to the Tcl interpreter for
                            execution. Typically the xScrollCommand option consists
                            of the path name of a scrollbar widget followed by



Widget-Specific Options


-command
Database name: command
Database class: Command
A script to evaluate on <Return>.
-inputtype
Database name: inputtype
Database class: InputType
The type of input allowed in the entry field. Valid input types are
                                integer, unsignedinteger,
                                double, bool,
                                hexadecimal, alphanumeric,
                                numeric, real, and
                                string. Default inputtype is
                                string.
-invalidcommand
Database name: invalidCommand
Database class: InvalidCommand
A script template to evaluate whenever the validate
                            command returns 0. See Validation for more information.
-justify
Database name: justify
Database class: Justify
Specifies how the text is aligned within the entry widget. One of
                                left, center, or
                                right.
-marker
Database name: marker
Database class: Marker
Specifies the color of the marker decorator. Can be either
                                info, error, or
                                warning. If not specified, hide the marker.
-show
Database name: show
Database class: Show
If this option is specified, then the true contents of the entry are not
                            displayed in the window. Instead, each character in the entry’s value
                            will be displayed as the first character in the value of this option,
                            such as “*”. This is useful, for example, if the entry is to be used to
                            enter a password. If characters in the entry are selected and copied
                            elsewhere, the information copied will be what is displayed, not the
                            true contents of the entry.
-validate
Database name: validate
Database class: Validate
Specifies the mode in which validation should operate:
                                none, focus,
                                focusin, focusout,
                                key, or all. Default is
                                none, meaning that validation is disabled. See
                                Validation.
-validatecommand
Database name: validateCommand
Database class: ValidateCommand
A script template to evaluate whenever validation is triggered. If set
                            to the empty string (the default), validation is disabled. The script
                            must return a boolean value. See Validation.



Widget Command


pathName
configure
?option? ?value option value …?
Query or modify the configuration options of the widget. If one or more
                            option-value pairs are specified, then the command modifies the given
                            widget option(s) to have the given value(s); in this case the command
                            returns an empty string. If option is specified with no
                            value, then the command returns a list describing the named
                                option: the elements of the list are the option
                            name, database name, database class, default value, and current value.
                            If no option is specified, returns a list describing all of the
                            available options for pathName.
pathName
cget
option
Returns the current value of the configuration option given by
                            option.
pathName
identify
element x y
Returns the name of the element under the point given by x and y, or an
                            empty string if the point does not lie within any element. x and y are
                            pixel coordinates relative to the widget. Some widgets accept other
                            identify subcommands.
pathName
instate
statespec ?script?
Test the widget’s state. If script is not specified, returns 1 if the
                            widget state matches statespec and 0 otherwise. If script is specified,
                            equivalent to
                            if{[pathNameinstatestateSpec]}script
pathName
bbox
index
Returns a list of four numbers describing the bounding box of the
                            character given by index. The first two elements of the
                            list give the x and y coordinates of the upper-left corner of the screen
                            area covered by the character (in pixels relative to the widget) and the
                            last two elements give the width and height of the character, in pixels.
                            The bounding box may refer to a region outside the visible area of the
                            window.
pathName
delete
first ?last?
Delete one or more elements of the entry. First is the
                            index of the first character to delete, and last is the
                            index of the character just after the last one to delete. If
                                last isn’t specified it defaults to
                                first+1, that is, a single character is deleted.
                            This command returns the empty string.
pathName
get
Returns the entry's string.
pathName
icursor
index
Arrange for the insert cursor to be displayed just before the character
                            given by index. Returns the empty string.
pathName
index
string
Arrange for the insert cursor to be displayed just before the character
                            given by index. Returns the empty string.
pathName
insert
 index string
Insert string just before the character indicated by
                                index. Returns the empty string.
pathName
invoke
index
Invokes the action of the combobox selection.
pathName
selection
option arg
This command is used to adjust the selection within an entry. It has
                            several forms, depending on option:
pathName
selection
clear
Clear the selection if it is currently in this widget. If
                                        the selection isn’t in this widget then the command has no
                                        effect. Returns the empty string.
pathName
selection
present
Returns 1 if there is are characters selected in the entry,
                                        0 if nothing is selected.
pathName
selection range
start end
Sets the selection to include the characters starting with
                                        the one indexed by start and ending with
                                        the one just before end. If
                                            end refers to the same character as
                                            start or an earlier one, then the
                                        entry’s selection is cleared.


pathName
set
str
Sets the entity's value to str.
pathName
xview
args
This command is used to query and change the horizontal position of the
                            text in the widget’s window. It can take any of the following forms:
pathName
xview
Returns a list containing two elements. Each element is a
                                        real fraction between 0 and 1; together they describe the
                                        horizontal span that is visible in the window. For example,
                                        if the first element is .2 and the second element is .6, 20%
                                        of the entry’s text is offscreen to the left, the middle 40%
                                        is visible in the window, and 40% of the text is offscreen
                                        to the right. These are the same values passed to scrollbars
                                        via the -xscrollcommand option.


pathName
xview
index
Adjusts the view in the window so that the character given
                                        by index is displayed at the left edge of
                                        the window.
pathName
xview moveto
fraction
Adjusts the view in the window so that the character
                                            fraction of the way through the text
                                        appears at the left edge of the window.
                                            fraction must be a fraction between 0
                                        and 1.
pathName
xview scroll
number what
This command shifts the view in the window left or right
                                        according to number and
                                            what. Number must be
                                        an integer. What must be either units or
                                        pages. If what is units, the view adjusts
                                        left or right by number average width
                                        characters on the display; if it is pages then the view
                                        adjusts by number screenfuls. If
                                            number is negative then characters
                                        farther to the left become visible; if it is positive then
                                        characters farther to the right become visible.





Example

::hwtk::dialog .d -title "::hwtk::entry"
set f [.d recess]

hwtk::label $f.l1 -text "String"
hwtk::entry $f.e1 -help "String entry"

hwtk::label $f.l2 -text "Unsigned integer"
hwtk::entry $f.e2 -inputtype unsignedinteger -help "Unsigned integer entry"

hwtk::label $f.l3 -text "Double"
hwtk::entry $f.e3 -inputtype double -help "Double entry"

hwtk::label $f.l4 -text "Disabled"
hwtk::entry $f.e4 -state disabled -help "Disabled entry"

grid columnconfigure $f 1 -weight 1
for {set i 1} {$i<=4} {incr i} {
    grid $f.l$i -row $i -col 0 -sticky w;
    grid $f.e$i -row $i -col 1 -sticky e -pady 2
}

.d post

-text变量选项。入口小部件支持水平
使用标准-xscroll命令选项滚动，然后
xview小部件命令。

标准选项


-客户端数据
数据库名称：clientData
数据库类：ClientData

Tk_GetCursor和Tk中的游标（n）
法律价值参考手册。如果设置为空字符串（
默认值），则光标从父窗口小部件继承。

通过小部件。

调用已分配-help命令的动态帮助
当用户在小部件上移动鼠标时。返回的文本
通过-help命令将依次显示在
工具提示。
-标记
数据库名称：标记

指定标记装饰器的颜色。可以是任意一种
信息、错误或
警告如果未指定，请隐藏标记。
状态
数据库名称：状态
数据库类：State
可以设置为正常或禁用以控制禁用状态位。
-聚焦
数据库名称：takeFocus
数据库类：TakeFocus
确定窗口在键盘操作期间是否接受焦点
遍历。0、1或命令前缀（小部件路径指向的前缀
已附加，应返回0或1），或空字符串。请参阅
完整的Tk参考手册中的选项（n）
描述
-text变量
数据库名称：textVariable
数据库类：变量
指定全局变量的名称。变量的值是
要在小部件内部显示的文本字符串；如果变量值
更改后，小部件将自动更新自身以反映
新的价值。字符串在小部件中显示的方式
取决于特定的小部件，并且可以由其他选项来确定，
例如锚定或定位。
宽度
数据库名称：宽度
数据库类：宽度
指定小部件的宽度。
-xscroll命令
数据库名称：xScrollCommand
数据库类：ScrollCommand
指定用于与水平通信的命令的前缀
滚动条。当小部件窗口中的视图发生更改时（或每当
发生任何其他可能更改滚动条中显示的事情，例如
作为小部件内容总大小的变化），小部件将
通过将滚动命令和两个
数字。每个数字都是0到1之间的一个分数
指示文档中的位置。0表示的开始
文档，1表示结束，.333表示三分之一的位置
通过文档的方式，依此类推。第一个分数表示
文档中在窗口中可见的第一个信息，以及
第二部分表示最后一部分之后的信息
这是可见的。然后将该命令传递给Tcl解释器，用于
处决xScrollCommand选项通常包括
的路径名，后跟



小工具特定选项


命令
数据库名称：命令
数据库类：命令
要在<Return>上评估的脚本。
-输入类型
数据库名称：inputtype
数据库类：InputType
输入字段中允许的输入类型。有效的输入类型为
整数，无符号整数，
double，bool，
十六进制、字母数字，
数字、实数和
一串默认输入类型为
一串
-invalidcommand
数据库名称：invalidCommand
数据库类：InvalidCommand
验证时要评估的脚本模板

证明正当
数据库名称：对齐
数据库类：Justify
指定文本在条目小部件中的对齐方式。什么之中的一个
左侧、中间或
正确的
-标记
数据库名称：标记
数据库类：Marker
指定标记装饰器的颜色。可以是任意一种
信息、错误或
警告如果未指定，请隐藏标记。
显示
数据库名称：显示
数据库类：显示
如果指定了此选项，则条目的真实内容不会
显示在窗口中。相反，条目值中的每个字符
将显示为该选项值中的第一个字符，
例如例如，如果条目要用于

在其他地方，复制的信息将是显示的信息，而不是
条目的真实内容。
验证
数据库名称：validate
数据库类：验证
指定验证操作的模式：
无，聚焦，
聚焦，聚焦，
键或全部。默认为
none，意味着验证被禁用。看见
验证。
-验证命令
数据库名称：validateCommand
数据库类：ValidateCommand

必须返回布尔值。请参阅验证。



小工具命令


路径名称
配置
?选项value选项值…？
查询或修改小部件的配置选项。如果一个或多个
指定选项值对，然后该命令修改给定的
具有给定值的窗口小部件选项；在这种情况下，命令
返回一个空字符串。如果指定选项时没有
值，则该命令返回一个列表，描述命名的
选项：列表中的元素是选项
名称、数据库名称、数据库类、默认值和当前值。
如果未指定任何选项，则返回一个列表，其中描述
pathName的可用选项。
路径名称
cget
选项
返回由给定的配置选项的当前值
选项
路径名称
识别
元素x y
返回由x和y给定的点下的元素的名称，或
如果点不在任何元素内，则为空字符串。x和y是
相对于小部件的像素坐标。一些小部件接受其他
识别子命令。
路径名称
任命
州规范？剧本
测试小部件的状态。如果未指定脚本，则如果
小部件状态与statespec匹配，否则为0。如果指定了脚本，
相当于
if｛[pathNameinstatesteSpec]｝脚本
路径名称
口技
指数
返回描述的边界框的四个数字的列表
由索引给定的字符。的前两个元素
列表给出屏幕左上角的x和y坐标
字符覆盖的区域（相对于小部件的像素）和
最后两个元素给出了字符的宽度和高度（以像素为单位）。
边界框可以指的是
窗
路径名称
删去
第一最后的
删除条目的一个或多个元素。首先是
要删除的第一个字符的索引，最后一个是
最后一个要删除的字符之后的字符索引。如果
没有指定last，它默认为
第一+1，即删除单个字符。
此命令返回空字符串。
路径名称
收到
返回条目的字符串。
路径名称
icursor
指数
安排插入光标刚好显示在字符之前
由索引给出。返回空字符串。
路径名称
指数
一串
安排插入光标刚好显示在字符之前
由索引给出。返回空字符串。
路径名称
插入
索引字符串
在所指示的字符之前插入字符串
指数返回空字符串。
路径名称
援引
指数
调用组合框选择的操作。
路径名称
选择
选项arg
此命令用于调整条目中的选择。它有
多种形式，具体取决于选项：
路径名称
选择
清楚的
如果选择当前在此小部件中，则清除该选择。如果
选择不在此小部件中，则命令没有
效应返回空字符串。
路径名称
选择
目前
如果条目中有选定的字符，则返回1，
如果未选择任何内容，则为0。
路径名称
选择范围
开始-结束
将所选内容设置为包括以开头的字符
以开头和结尾索引的
结束前的那个。如果
end指的是与相同的字符
开始或更早的一个，然后
条目的选择被清除。


路径名称
设置
str
将实体的值设置为str。
路径名称
xview
args
此命令用于查询和更改
小部件窗口中的文本。它可以采取以下任何形式：
路径名称
xview
返回一个包含两个元素的列表。每个元素都是
0和1之间的实数分数；他们一起描述
在窗口中可见的水平跨度。例如
如果第一个元素是.2，第二个元素是.6，则为20%
的文本位于屏幕外左侧，中间40%
在窗口中可见，40%的文本在屏幕外
向右。这些是传递给滚动条的相同值
通过-xscroll命令选项。


路径名称
xview
指数
调整窗口中的视图，使给定的字符
按索引显示在的左边缘
窗户。
路径名称
xview moveto
小部分
调整窗口中的视图，使角色
文本的一小部分
显示在窗口的左边缘。
分数必须是0之间的分数
和1。
路径名称
xview卷轴
数字什么
此命令向左或向右移动窗口中的视图
根据数量和
什么数字必须为
一个整数。什么必须是单位或
页。如果什么是单位，则视图会调整
左或右按数字平均宽度
显示器上的字符；如果是页面，则视图
按筛选次数进行调整。如果
数字为负数，然后为个字符
向左更远的地方变得可见；如果是正的，那么
更右边的字符变得可见。





实例

：：hwtk:：dialog.d-title“：：hwtk:：entry”
集合f[.d凹陷]

hwtk:：label$f.l1-text“字符串”
hwtk:：entry$f.e1-帮助“字符串输入”

hwtk:：label$f.l2-text“无符号整数”
hwtk:：entry$f.e2-inputtype unsignedinteger-help“无符号整数项”

hwtk:：label$f.l3-text“Double”
hwtk:：entry$f.e3-inputtype double-help“double entry”

hwtk:：label$f.l4-text“已禁用”
hwtk:：entry$f.e4-state disabled-help“disabled entry”

网格列配置$f 1-权重1
对于｛set i 1｝｛$i＜＝4｝｛｛incr i｝{
网格$f.l$i-行$i-列0-粘性w；
网格$f.e$i-行$i-列1-粘性电子板2
}
