doc_content:
hwtk::scalerange
Create and manipulate a scale range widget.
Format
hwtk::scalerange - pathName ?option value? …

Description
A hwtk::scalerange widget is used to select a range of values. A scale displays a
                start range select slider and an end range select slider both of which can be moved
                along over a trough, with the relative position of the sliders over the trough
                indicating the values.

Standard Options


-clientdata
Database name: clientData
Database class: ClientData
Acts as a data storage for a widgets. User can store any data and this
                            will not have any effect on widget property.
-state
Database name: state
Database class: State
May be set to normal or disabled to control the disabled state bit.



Widget-Specific Options


-command
?command?
Specifies the prefix of a Tcl command to invoke whenever the scale’s
                            value is changed via a widget command. The actual command consists of
                            this option followed by a space and a real number indicating the new
                            value of the scale.
-from
?value?
Beginning value for the scale. Without argument, returns the current
                                from value. Default is 0.
-showruler
?value?
Display ruler tickmarks for scale. Values are 1 or 0. Default is 1.
-step
?value?
Sets the increment between the ruler tickmarks. Without argument,
                            returns the current step value.
-to
?value?
Specifies the maximum value on the scale. Without argument, returns the
                            current to value. Default is 100.



Widget Command


pathName
configure
?option? ?value option value …?
Query or modify the configuration options of the widget. If one or more
                            option-value pairs are specified, then the command modifies the given
                            widget option(s) to have the given value(s); in this case the command
                            returns an empty string. If option is specified with no
                            value, then the command returns a list describing the named
                                option: the elements of the list are the option
                            name, database name, database class, default value, and current value.
                            If no option is specified, returns a list describing all of the
                            available options for pathName.
pathName
cget
option
Returns the current value of the configuration option given by
                            option.
pathName
identify
element x y
Returns the name of the element under the point given by x and y, or an
                            empty string if the point does not lie within any element. x and y are
                            pixel coordinates relative to the widget. Some widgets accept other
                            identify subcommands.
pathName
instate
statespec ?script?
Test the widget’s state. If script is not specified, returns 1 if the
                            widget state matches statespec and 0 otherwise. If script is specified,
                            equivalent to
                            if{[pathNameinstatestateSpec]}script
pathName
state
?stateSpec?
Modify or inquire widget state. If stateSpec is
                            present, sets the widget state: for each flag in
                                stateSpec, sets the corresponding flag or clears it
                            if prefixed by an exclamation point. Returns a new state spec indicating
                            which flags were changed:
                            setchanges[pathNamestatespec]
pathNamestate$changeswill
                            restore pathName to the original state. If
                                stateSpec is not specified, returns a list of the
                            currently-enabled state flags.
pathName
endrange
?value?
With no arguments, returns current selected maximum value of the scale.
                            With value, sets maximum selected value on the scale.
                            Default is 100.0.
pathName
startrange
?value?
With no arguments, returns current selected minimum value of the scale.
                            With value, sets minimum selected value on the scale.
                            Default is 0.0.



Example

hwtk::dialog .dlg -title "::hwtk::scalerange"

set w [.dlg recess]

hwtk::scalerange $w.s -from 1 -to 10 
$w.s configure -step 1
$w.s startrange 3
$w.s endrange 6
pack $w.s

创建和操作缩放范围小部件。
总体安排
hwtk:：scalrange-pathName？选项值…

描述

起始范围选择滑块和结束范围选择滑块都可以移动
沿着槽上方，滑块在槽上方的相对位置
指示值。

标准选项


-客户端数据
数据库名称：clientData
数据库类：ClientData
充当小部件的数据存储。用户可以存储任何数据，并且
不会对小部件属性产生任何影响。
状态
数据库名称：状态
数据库类：State
可以设置为正常或禁用以控制禁用状态位。



小工具特定选项


命令
?命令
指定Tcl命令的前缀，每当刻度
值通过窗口小部件命令进行更改。实际命令包括
该选项后面跟着一个空格和一个实数，表示新的
刻度的值。
从…起
?价值
刻度的起始值。不带参数，返回当前
从价值。默认值为0。
-显示标尺
?价值
显示标尺刻度线。值为1或0。默认值为1。
步
?价值
设置标尺记号之间的增量。毫无疑问，
返回当前步长值。
到
?价值
指定比例上的最大值。不带参数，返回
电流值。默认值为100。



小工具命令


路径名称
配置
?选项value选项值…？
查询或修改小部件的配置选项。如果一个或多个
指定选项值对，然后该命令修改给定的
具有给定值的窗口小部件选项；在这种情况下，命令
返回一个空字符串。如果指定选项时没有
值，则该命令返回一个列表，描述命名的
选项：列表中的元素是选项
名称、数据库名称、数据库类、默认值和当前值。
如果未指定任何选项，则返回一个列表，其中描述
pathName的可用选项。
路径名称
cget
选项
返回由给定的配置选项的当前值
选项
路径名称
识别
元素x y
返回由x和y给定的点下的元素的名称，或
如果点不在任何元素内，则为空字符串。x和y是
相对于小部件的像素坐标。一些小部件接受其他
识别子命令。
路径名称
任命
州规范？剧本
测试小部件的状态。如果未指定脚本，则如果
小部件状态与statespec匹配，否则为0。如果指定了脚本，
相当于
if｛[pathNameinstatesteSpec]｝脚本
路径名称
状态
?stateSpec？
修改或查询小部件状态。如果stateSpec为
present，设置小部件状态：对于中的每个标志
stateSpec，设置相应的标志或将其清除
如果前缀是感叹号。返回一个新的状态规范，指示
哪些标志已更改：
setchanges[pathNamestatespec]
路径名称状态$changeswill
将pathName恢复到原始状态。如果
未指定stateSpec，返回的列表
当前启用的状态标志。
路径名称
结束范围
?价值
不带任何参数，返回当前选定的刻度最大值。
使用值，设置比例上的最大选定值。
默认值为100.0。
路径名称
起动范围
?价值
不带任何参数，返回当前选定的小数位数的最小值。
使用值，设置刻度上的最小选定值。
默认值为0.0。



实例

hwtk:：dialog.dlg-title“：hwtk::scalrange”

设置w[.dlg凹陷]

hwtk:：缩放范围$w.s-从1到10
$w.s配置-步骤1
$w.s起始范围3
$w.s结束范围6
包装$w.s

doc_content:
hwtk::scrollbar
Control the viewport of a scrollable widget.
Format
hwtk::scrollbar - pathName ?option value? …

Description
Scrollbar widgets are typically linked to an associated window that displays a
                document of some sort, such as a file being edited or a drawing. A scrollbar
                displays a "thumb" in the middle portion of the scrollbar, whose position and size
                provides information about the portion of the document visible in the associated
                window. The thumb may be dragged by the user to control the visible region.
                Depending on the theme, two or more arrow buttons may also be present; these are
                used to scroll the visible region in discrete units.

Standard Options


-clientdata
Database name: clientData
Database class: ClientData
Acts as a data storage for a widgets. User can store any data and this
                            will not have any effect on widget property.
-cursor
Database name: cursor
Database class: Cursor
Specifies the mouse cursor to be used for the widget. See
                                Tk_GetCursor and cursors(n) in the Tk
                            reference manual for the legal values. If set to the empty string (the
                            default), the cursor is inherited from the parent widget.
-helpcommand
Database name: helpcommand
Database class: Command
Dynamic help which calls an assigned -helpcommand
                            when the user moves the mouse on the widget. The text which is returned
                            by the -helpcommand will be in turn be displayed on
                            the tooltip.
-takefocus
Database name: takeFocus
Database class: TakeFocus
Determines whether the window accepts the focus during keyboard
                            traversal. Either 0, 1, a command prefix (to which the widget path is
                            appended, and which should return 0 or 1), or the empty string. See
                                options(n) in the Tk reference manual for the full
                            description.



Widget-Specific Options


-command
Database name: command
Database class: Command
A Tcl script prefix to evaluate to change the view in the widget
                            associated with the scrollbar. Additional arguments are appended to the
                            value of this option whenever the user requests
                            a view change by manipulating the scrollbar. This option typically
                            consists of a two-element list, containing the name of a scrollable
                            widget followed by either xview (for horizontal
                            scrollbars) or yview (for vertical scrollbars).
-orient
Database name: orient
Database class: Orient
Specifies the orientation whether the widget should be laid out
                            horizontally or vertically. Must be either horizontal
                            or vertical or an abbreviation of one of these. Default
                            is horizontal.



Widget Command


pathName
configure
?option? ?value option value …?
Query or modify the configuration options of the widget. If one or more
                            option-value pairs are specified, then the command modifies the given
                            widget option(s) to have the given value(s); in this case the command
                            returns an empty string. If option is specified with no
                            value, then the command returns a list describing the named
                                option: the elements of the list are the option
                            name, database name, database class, default value, and current value.
                            If no option is specified, returns a list describing all of the
                            available options for pathName.
pathName
cget
option
Returns the current value of the configuration option given by
                            option.
pathName
identify
element x y
Returns the name of the element under the point given by x and y, or an
                            empty string if the point does not lie within any element. x and y are
                            pixel coordinates relative to the widget. Some widgets accept other
                            identify subcommands.
pathName
instate
statespec ?script?
Test the widget’s state. If script is not specified, returns 1 if the
                            widget state matches statespec and 0 otherwise. If script is specified,
                            equivalent to
                            if{[pathNameinstatestateSpec]}script
pathName
state
?stateSpec?
Modify or inquire widget state. If stateSpec is
                            present, sets the widget state: for each flag in
                                stateSpec, sets the corresponding flag or clears it
                            if prefixed by an exclamation point. Returns a new state spec indicating
                            which flags were changed:
                            setchanges[pathNamestatespec]
pathNamestate$changeswill
                            restore pathName to the original state. If
                                stateSpec is not specified, returns a list of the
                            currently-enabled state flags.
pathName
get

Returns the scrollbar settings in the form of a list whose elements are
                            the arguments to the most recent set widget command.
pathName
set
first last
This command is normally invoked by the scrollbars associated widget
                            from an -xscrollcommand or
                                -yscrollcommand callback. Specifies the visible
                            range to be displayed. first and last
                            are real fractions between 0 and 1.



Internal Commands
The following widget commands are used internally by the TScrollbar widget class bindings.
pathName
delta
deltaX deltaY

Returns a real number indicating the fractional change in the scrollbar
                            setting that corresponds to a given change in thumb position. For
                            example, if the scrollbar is horizontal, the result indicates how much
                            the scrollbar setting must change to move the thumb
                                deltaX pixels to the right (deltaY
                            is ignored in this case). If the scrollbar is vertical, the result
                            indicates how much the scrollbar setting must change to move the thumb
                                deltaY pixels down. The arguments and the result
                            may be zero or negative.
pathName
fraction
x y
Returns a real number between 0 and 1 indicating where the point given
                            by x and y lies in the trough area of
                            the scrollbar, where 0.0 corresponds to the top or left of the trough
                            and 1.0 corresponds to the bottom or right. x and
                                y are pixel coordinates relative to the scrollbar
                            widget. If x and y refer to a point
                            outside the trough, the closest point in the trough is used.
pathName
identify
x y
Returns the name of the element under the point given by
                                x and y, or an empty string if the
                            point does not lie in any element of the scrollbar. x
                            and y are pixel coordinates relative to the scrollbar
                            widget.



Example

hwtk::dialog .dlg -title "::hwtk::scrollbar"
set recess [.dlg recess]

set sv [hwtk::scrollbar $recess.sv -command "$recess.text yview"]
set sh [hwtk::scrollbar $recess.sh -command "$recess.text xview" -orient horizontal]
set text [text $recess.text -yscrollcommand "$sv set" -xscrollcommand "$sh set" -wrap none]

grid $sv -row 0 -col 1 -sticky ns
grid $sh -sticky ew
grid $text -row 0 -sticky news

grid columnfigure $recess 0 -weight 1
grid rowfigure $recess 0 -weight 1

.dlg post
translated_doc_content:
hwtk:：滚动条
控制可滚动小部件的视口。
总体安排
hwtk:：滚动条-pathName？选项值…

描述
滚动条小部件通常链接到相关窗口，该窗口显示
某种文档，如正在编辑的文件或图形。滚动条
在滚动条的中间部分显示一个“拇指”，其位置和大小
提供了有关在关联中可见的文档部分的信息
窗用户可以拖动拇指来控制可见区域。
根据主题，还可能存在两个或多个箭头按钮；这些是
用于以离散单位滚动可见区域。

标准选项


-客户端数据
数据库名称：clientData
数据库类：ClientData
充当小部件的数据存储。用户可以存储任何数据，并且
不会对小部件属性产生任何影响。
-光标
数据库名称：游标
数据库类：游标
指定要用于小部件的鼠标光标。看见
Tk_GetCursor和Tk中的游标（n）
法律价值参考手册。如果设置为空字符串（
默认值），则光标从父窗口小部件继承。
-help命令
数据库名称：helpcommand
数据库类：命令
调用已分配-help命令的动态帮助
当用户在小部件上移动鼠标时。返回的文本
通过-help命令将依次显示在
工具提示。
-聚焦
数据库名称：takeFocus
数据库类：TakeFocus
确定窗口在键盘操作期间是否接受焦点
遍历。0、1或命令前缀（小部件路径指向的前缀
已附加，应返回0或1），或空字符串。请参阅
完整的Tk参考手册中的选项（n）
描述



小工具特定选项


命令
数据库名称：命令
数据库类：命令
用于更改小部件中视图的Tcl脚本前缀
与滚动条关联。附加的参数附加到
每当用户请求时该选项的值
通过操纵滚动条来更改视图。此选项通常
由两个元素的列表组成，其中包含可滚动项的名称
小部件后面跟着xview（用于水平
滚动条）或yview（用于垂直滚动条）。
朝向
数据库名称：orient
数据库类：Orient
指定是否应布置小部件的方向
水平或垂直。必须是水平的
或者垂直的，或者它们中的一个的缩写。违约
是水平的。



小工具命令


路径名称
配置
?选项value选项值…？
查询或修改小部件的配置选项。如果一个或多个
指定选项值对，然后该命令修改给定的
具有给定值的窗口小部件选项；在这种情况下，命令
返回一个空字符串。如果指定选项时没有
值，则该命令返回一个列表，描述命名的
选项：列表中的元素是选项
名称、数据库名称、数据库类、默认值和当前值。
如果未指定任何选项，则返回一个列表，其中描述
pathName的可用选项。
路径名称
cget
选项
返回由给定的配置选项的当前值
选项
路径名称
识别
元素x y
返回由x和y给定的点下的元素的名称，或
如果点不在任何元素内，则为空字符串。x和y是
相对于小部件的像素坐标。一些小部件接受其他
识别子命令。
路径名称
任命
州规范？剧本
测试小部件的状态。如果未指定脚本，则如果
小部件状态与statespec匹配，否则为0。如果指定了脚本，
相当于
if｛[pathNameinstatesteSpec]｝脚本
路径名称
状态
?stateSpec？
修改或查询小部件状态。如果stateSpec为
present，设置小部件状态：对于中的每个标志
stateSpec，设置相应的标志或将其清除
如果前缀是感叹号。返回一个新的状态规范，指示
哪些标志已更改：
setchanges[pathNamestatespec]
路径名称状态$changeswill
将pathName恢复到原始状态。如果
未指定stateSpec，返回的列表
当前启用的状态标志。
路径名称
收到

以列表的形式返回滚动条设置，其元素为
最新的set小部件命令的参数。
路径名称
设置
倒数第一
此命令通常由与滚动条相关的小部件调用
从-xscroll命令或
-yscroll命令回调。指定可见
要显示的范围。第一个和最后一个
是0和1之间的实数分数。



内部命令
TScrollbar小部件类绑定在内部使用以下小部件命令。
路径名称
希腊字母表的第4个字母
deltaX deltaY

返回一个实数，指示滚动条中的分数变化
与拇指位置的给定变化相对应的设置。对于
例如，如果滚动条是水平的，则结果指示多少
滚动条设置必须更改才能移动拇指
右边的deltaX像素（deltaY
在这种情况下被忽略）。如果滚动条是垂直的，则结果
指示滚动条设置必须更改多少才能移动拇指
deltaY像素向下。论点和结果
可以是零或负。
路径名称
小部分
x y
返回一个介于0和1之间的实数，指示给定点的位置
by x和y位于的波谷区域
滚动条，其中0.0对应于槽的顶部或左侧
1.0对应于底部或右侧。x和
y是相对于滚动条的像素坐标
小装置。如果x和y指的是一个点
在槽外，使用槽内最近的点。
路径名称
识别
x y
返回给定点下元素的名称
x和y，或者如果
点不在滚动条的任何元素中。x
y是相对于滚动条的像素坐标
小装置。



实例

hwtk:：dialog.dlg-title“：：hwtk：：滚动条”
设置凹槽[.dlg凹槽]

set sv[hwtk:：滚动条$recess.sv-命令“$recess.text yview”]
设置sh[hwtk:：滚动条$recess.sh-命令“$recess.text xview”-水平方向]
set text[text$recess.text-yscrollcommand“$sv set”-xscrollcommand“$sh set”-wrap none]

网格$sv-行0-列1-粘性ns
网格$sh-粘性ew
网格$text-第0行-粘性新闻

网格柱图形$凹陷0-权重1
网格行数字$凹陷0-权重1

.dlg帖子

doc_content:
hwtk::separator
Separator bar.
Format
hwtk::separator - pathName ?option value? …

Description
A hwtk::separator widget displays a horizontal or vertical separator bar.

Standard Options


-clientdata
Database name: clientData
Database class: ClientData
Acts as a data storage for a widgets. User can store any data and this
                            will not have any effect on widget property.
-cursor
Database name: cursor
Database class: Cursor
Specifies the mouse cursor to be used for the widget. See
                                Tk_GetCursor and cursors(n) in the Tk
                            reference manual for the legal values. If set to the empty string (the
                            default), the cursor is inherited from the parent widget.
-help
Database name: help
Database class: Text
Specifies the text or help message that displays when the cursor moves
                            over the widget.
-helpcommand
Database name: helpcommand
Database class: Command
Dynamic help which calls an assigned -helpcommand
                            when the user moves the mouse on the widget. The text which is returned
                            by the -helpcommand will be in turn be displayed on
                            the tooltip.
-takefocus
Database name: takeFocus
Database class: TakeFocus
Determines whether the window accepts the focus during keyboard
                            traversal. Either 0, 1, a command prefix (to which the widget path is
                            appended, and which should return 0 or 1), or the empty string. See
                                options(n) in the Tk reference manual for the full
                            description.



Widget-Specific Options


-orient
Database name: orient
Database class: Orient
Specifies the orientation whether the widget should be laid out
                            horizontally or vertically. Must be either horizontal
                            or vertical or an abbreviation of one of these. Default
                            is horizontal.



Widget Command


pathName
configure
?option? ?value option value …?
Query or modify the configuration options of the widget. If one or more
                            option-value pairs are specified, then the command modifies the given
                            widget option(s) to have the given value(s); in this case the command
                            returns an empty string. If option is specified with no
                            value, then the command returns a list describing the named
                                option: the elements of the list are the option
                            name, database name, database class, default value, and current value.
                            If no option is specified, returns a list describing all of the
                            available options for pathName.
pathName
cget
option
Returns the current value of the configuration option given by
                            option.
pathName
identify
element x y
Returns the name of the element under the point given by x and y, or an
                            empty string if the point does not lie within any element. x and y are
                            pixel coordinates relative to the widget. Some widgets accept other
                            identify subcommands.
pathName
instate
statespec ?script?
Test the widget’s state. If script is not specified, returns 1 if the
                            widget state matches statespec and 0 otherwise. If script is specified,
                            equivalent to
                            if{[pathNameinstatestateSpec]}script
pathName
state
?stateSpec?
Modify or inquire widget state. If stateSpec is
                            present, sets the widget state: for each flag in
                                stateSpec, sets the corresponding flag or clears it
                            if prefixed by an exclamation point. Returns a new state spec indicating
                            which flags were changed:
                            setchanges[pathNamestatespec]
pathNamestate$changeswill
                            restore pathName to the original state. If
                                stateSpec is not specified, returns a list of the
                            currently-enabled state flags.



Example

#::hwtk::separator

hwtk::dialog .d -title "::hwtk::separator"
set recess [.d recess]

pack [hwtk::frame $recess.left] -side left 
pack [hwtk::frame $recess.right] -side right
pack [hwtk::separator $recess.sep] -orient vertical] -side left -fill y -expand true
pack [hwtk::label $recess.left.l -text "Left"]
pack [hwtk::label $recess.right.r -text "Right"]

.d post

路径名称

路径名称

返回由x和y给定的点下的元素的名称，或

任命
州规范？剧本
测试小部件的状态。如果未指定脚本，则如果

if｛[pathNameinstatesteSpec]｝脚本

?stateSpec？
修改或查询小部件状态。如果stateSpec为

实例

#：hwtk:：分隔符

hwtk:：dialog.d-title“：hwtk：：分隔符”
设置凹陷[.d凹陷]

doc_content:
hwtk::sizegrip
Allows the user to resize the containing top level window by pressing and dragging
        the grip. Also known as a grow box.
Format
hwtk::sizegrip - pathName ?option value? …

Standard Options


-clientdata
Database name: clientData
Database class: ClientData
Acts as a data storage for a widgets. User can store any data and this
                            will not have any effect on widget property.
-cursor
Database name: cursor
Database class: Cursor
Specifies the mouse cursor to be used for the widget. See
                                Tk_GetCursor and cursors(n) in the Tk
                            reference manual for the legal values. If set to the empty string (the
                            default), the cursor is inherited from the parent widget.
-help
Database name: help
Database class: Text
Specifies the text or help message that displays when the cursor moves
                            over the widget.
-helpcommand
Database name: helpcommand
Database class: Command
Dynamic help which calls an assigned -helpcommand
                            when the user moves the mouse on the widget. The text which is returned
                            by the -helpcommand will be in turn be displayed on
                            the tooltip.
-takefocus
Database name: takeFocus
Database class: TakeFocus
Determines whether the window accepts the focus during keyboard
                            traversal. Either 0, 1, a command prefix (to which the widget path is
                            appended, and which should return 0 or 1), or the empty string. See
                                options(n) in the Tk reference manual for the full
                            description.



Widget Command


pathName
configure
?option? ?value option value …?
Query or modify the configuration options of the widget. If one or more
                            option-value pairs are specified, then the command modifies the given
                            widget option(s) to have the given value(s); in this case the command
                            returns an empty string. If option is specified with no
                            value, then the command returns a list describing the named
                                option: the elements of the list are the option
                            name, database name, database class, default value, and current value.
                            If no option is specified, returns a list describing all of the
                            available options for pathName.
pathName
cget
option
Returns the current value of the configuration option given by
                            option.
pathName
identify
element x y
Returns the name of the element under the point given by x and y, or an
                            empty string if the point does not lie within any element. x and y are
                            pixel coordinates relative to the widget. Some widgets accept other
                            identify subcommands.
pathName
instate
statespec ?script?
Test the widget’s state. If script is not specified, returns 1 if the
                            widget state matches statespec and 0 otherwise. If script is specified,
                            equivalent to
                            if{[pathNameinstatestateSpec]}script
pathName
state
?stateSpec?
Modify or inquire widget state. If stateSpec is
                            present, sets the widget state: for each flag in
                                stateSpec, sets the corresponding flag or clears it
                            if prefixed by an exclamation point. Returns a new state spec indicating
                            which flags were changed:
                            setchanges[pathNamestatespec]
pathNamestate$changeswill
                            restore pathName to the original state. If
                                stateSpec is not specified, returns a list of the
                            currently-enabled state flags.



Example

hwtk::topdialog .t -title "::hwtk::sizegrip"
pack [hwtk::sizegrip .t.sg -help "Click and drag to move"] -side right -anchor se
